Screen.label: Screen
Screen.hint: Which physical screen to run on (1 or 2)

Show mouse.label: Show mouse
Show mouse.hint: Should the mouse be visible on screen? Only applicable for fullscreen experiments.

Units.label: Units
Units.hint: Units to use for window/stimulus coordinates (e.g. cm, pix, deg)

color.label: Background color
color.hint: Color of the screen (e.g. black, $[1.0,1.0,1.0], $variable. Right-click to bring up a color-picker.)

blendMode.label: Blend mode
blendMode.hint: Should new stimuli be added or averaged with the stimuli that have been drawn already

colorSpace.label: Color space
colorSpace.hint: Needed if color is defined numerically (see PsychoPy documentation on color spaces)

backgroundImg.label: Background image
backgroundImg.hint: Image file to use as a background (leave blank for no image)

backgroundFit.label: Background fit
backgroundFit.hint: How should the background image scale to fit the window size?

measureFrameRate.label: Measure frame rate?
measureFrameRate.hint: Should we measure your frame rate at the start of the experiment? This is highly recommended for precise timing.

frameRate.label: Frame rate
frameRate.hint: Frame rate to store instead of measuring at the start of the experiment. Leave blank to store no frame rate, but be wary: This will lead to errors if frame rate isn't supplied by other means.

frameRateMsg.val: Attempting to measure frame rate of screen, please wait...
frameRateMsg.label: Frame rate message
frameRateMsg.hint: Message to display while frame rate is measured. Leave blank for no message.

Data filename.label: Data filename
Data filename.hint: Code to create your custom file name base. Don't give a file extension - this will be added.

Data file delimiter.label: Data file delimiter
Data file delimiter.hint: What symbol should the data file use to separate columns? Auto will select a delimiter automatically from the filename.

sortColumns.label: Sort columns by...
sortColumns.hint: How should data file columns be sorted? Alphabetically, by priority, or simply in the order they were added?

colPriority.label: Column priority
colPriority.hint: Assign priority values to certain columns. To use predefined values, you can do $priority.HIGH, $priority.MEDIUM, etc.

Save excel file.label: Save Excel file
Save excel file.hint: Save data from loops in Excel (.xlsx) format

Save log file.label: Save log file
Save log file.hint: Save a detailed log (more detailed than the Excel/csv files) of the entire experiment

Save csv file.label: Save csv file (summaries)
Save csv file.hint: Save data from loops in comma-separated-value (.csv) format for maximum portability

Save wide csv file.label: Save csv file (trial-by-trial)
Save wide csv file.hint: Save data from loops in comma-separated-value (.csv) format for maximum portability

Save psydat file.label: Save psydat file
Save psydat file.hint: Save data from loops in psydat format. This is useful for Python programmers to generate analysis scripts.

Save hdf5 file.label: Save hdf5 file
Save hdf5 file.hint: Save data from eyetrackers in hdf5 format. This is useful for viewing and analyzing complex data in structures.

logging level.label: File logging level
logging level.hint: How much output do you want in the log files? ('error' is fewest messages, 'debug' is most)

consoleLoggingLevel.label: Console / app logging level
consoleLoggingLevel.hint: How much output do you want displayed in the console / app? ('error' is fewest messages, 'debug' is most)

clockFormat.label: Clock format
clockFormat.hint: Format to use for Routine start timestamps; either wall clock time (in ISO 8601 format) or seconds since experiment start (as a float).

eyetracker.label: Eyetracker device
eyetracker.hint: What kind of eye tracker should PsychoPy use? Select 'MouseGaze' to use the mouse to simulate eye movement (for debugging without a tracker connected)

gpAddress.label: GazePoint IP address
gpAddress.hint: IP Address of the computer running GazePoint Control.

gpPort.label: GazePoint port
gpPort.hint: Port of the GazePoint Control server. Usually 4242.

elAddress.label: EyeLink IP address
elAddress.hint: IP Address of the EyeLink *Host* computer.

elSimMode.label: Mouse simulation mode
elSimMode.hint: Set the EyeLink to run in mouse simulation mode.

mgMove.label: Move button
mgMove.hint: Mouse button to press for eye movement.

mgBlink.label: Blink button
mgBlink.hint: Mouse button to press for a blink.

mgSaccade.label: Saccade threshold
mgSaccade.hint: Visual degree threshold for Saccade event creation.

elLiveFiltering.label: Live sample filtering
elLiveFiltering.hint: Filter eye sample data live, as it is streamed to the driving device. This may reduce the sampling speed.

elDataFiltering.label: Saved sample filtering
elDataFiltering.hint: Filter eye sample data when it is saved to the output file. This will not affect the sampling speed.

elPupilAlgorithm.label: Pupil center algorithm
elPupilAlgorithm.hint: Algorithm used to detect the pupil center.

elPupilMeasure.label: Pupil data type
elPupilMeasure.hint: Type of pupil data to record.

plPupillometryOnly.label: Pupillometry only
plPupillometryOnly.hint: Subscribe to pupil data only, does not require calibration or surface setup

plSurfaceName.label: Surface name
plSurfaceName.hint: Name of the Pupil Capture surface

ecSampleRate.label: Sampling rate
ecSampleRate.hint: Eyetracker sampling rate: 'default' or <integer>[Hz]. Defaults to tracking mode '0'.

keyboardBackend.label: Keyboard backend
keyboardBackend.hint: What Python package should PsychoPy use to get keyboard input?

SliderComponent.tooltip: Slider: A simple, flexible object for getting ratings

name.label: Name
name.hint: Name of this Component (alphanumeric or _, no spaces)

startEstim.label: Expected start (s)
startEstim.hint: (Optional) expected start (s), purely for representing in the timeline

startType.label: Start type
startType.hint: How do you want to define your start point?

stopVal.label: Stop
stopVal.hint: When does the Component end? (blank is endless)

durationEstim.label: Expected duration (s)
durationEstim.hint: (Optional) expected duration (s), purely for representing in the timeline

stopType.label: Stop type
stopType.hint: How do you want to define your end point?

color.label: Label color
color.hint: Color of all labels on this slider (might be overridden by the style setting)

fillColor.label: Marker color
fillColor.hint: Color of the marker on this slider (might be overridden by the style setting)

borderColor.label: Line color
borderColor.hint: Color of all lines on this slider (might be overridden by the style setting)

colorSpace.label: Color space
colorSpace.hint: In what format (color space) have you specified the colors? (rgb, dkl, lms, hsv)

opacity.label: Opacity
opacity.hint: Opacity of the stimulus (1=opaque, 0=fully transparent, 0.5=translucent). Leave blank for each color to have its own opacity (recommended if any color is None).

size.label: Size [w,h]
size.hint: Size of this stimulus (either a single value or x,y pair, e.g. 2.5, [1,2]

units.label: Spatial units
units.hint: Units of dimensions for this stimulus

forceEndRoutine.label: Force end of Routine
forceEndRoutine.hint: Should setting a rating (releasing the mouse) cause the end of the Routine (e.g. trial)?

contrast.label: Contrast
contrast.hint: Contrast of the stimulus (1.0=unchanged contrast, 0.5=decrease contrast, 0.0=uniform/no contrast, -0.5=slightly inverted, -1.0=totally inverted)

styles.label: Styles
styles.hint: Discrete styles to control the overall appearance of the slider.

styleTweaks.label: Style tweaks
styleTweaks.hint: Tweaks to change the appearance of the slider beyond its style.

flip.label: Flip
flip.hint: By default the labels will be on the bottom or left of the scale, but this can be flipped to the other side.

ticks.label: Ticks
ticks.hint: Tick positions (numerical) on the scale, separated by commas

labels.label: Labels
labels.hint: Labels for the tick marks on the scale, separated by commas

granularity.label: Granularity
granularity.hint: Specifies the minimum step size (0 for a continuous scale, 1 for integer rating scale)

readOnly.label: Read only
readOnly.hint: Should participant be able to change the rating on the Slider?

saveStartStop.label: Save onset/offset times
saveStartStop.hint: Store the onset/offset times in the data file (as well as in the log file).

syncScreenRefresh.label: Sync timing with screen refresh
syncScreenRefresh.hint: Synchronize times with screen refresh (good for visual stimuli and responses based on them)

validator.label: Validate with...
validator.hint: Name of validator Component/Routine to use to check the timing of this stimulus.

initVal.label: Starting value
initVal.hint: Value of the slider befre any response, leave blank to hide the marker until clicked on

letterHeight.label: Letter height
letterHeight.hint: Letter height for text in labels

storeRatingTime.label: Store rating time
storeRatingTime.hint: Store the time taken to make the choice (in seconds)

CounterbalanceRoutine.tooltip: Counterbalance Routine: use the Shelf to choose a value taking into account previous runs of this experiment.

name.label: Name
name.hint: Name of this Routine (alphanumeric or _, no spaces)

specMode.label: Groups from...
specMode.hint: Specify groups using an Excel file (for fine tuned control), specify as a variable name, or specify a number of groups to create equally likely groups with a uniform cap.

conditionsFile.label: Conditions
conditionsFile.hint: Name of a file specifying the parameters for each group (.csv, .xlsx, or .pkl). Browse to select a file. Right-click to preview file contents, or create a new file.

nSlots.label: Slots per group
nSlots.hint: Max number of participants in each group for each repeat.

nReps.label: Num. repeats
nReps.hint: How many times to run slots down to depletion?

endExperimentOnDepletion.label: End experiment on depletion
endExperimentOnDepletion.hint: When all slots and repetitions are depleted, should the experiment end or continue with .finished on this Routine as True?

saveData.label: Save data
saveData.hint: Save chosen group and associated params this repeat to the data file?

saveRemaining.label: Save remaining cap
saveRemaining.hint: Save the remaining cap for the chosen group this repeat to the data file?

conditionsVariable.label: Conditions
conditionsVariable.hint: Name of a variable specifying the parameters for each group. Should be a list of dicts, like the output of data.conditionsFromFile

name.label: Name
name.hint: Name of this Routine (alphanumeric or _, no spaces)

targetLayout.label: Target layout
targetLayout.hint: How many targets do you want to be presented for calibration? Points will be displayed in a grid.

targetPositions.label: Target positions
targetPositions.hint: List of positions (x, y) at which the target can appear

randomisePos.label: Randomise target positions
randomisePos.hint: Should the order of target positions be randomised?

cursorFillColor.label: Gaze cursor color
cursorFillColor.hint: Fill color of the gaze cursor

textColor.label: Text color
textColor.hint: Color of text used in validation procedure.

fillColor.label: Outer fill color
fillColor.hint: Fill color of the outer part of the target

borderColor.label: Outer border color
borderColor.hint: Border color of the outer part of the target

innerFillColor.label: Inner fill color
innerFillColor.hint: Fill color of the inner part of the target

innerBorderColor.label: Inner border color
innerBorderColor.hint: Border color of the inner part of the target

colorSpace.label: Color space
colorSpace.hint: In what format (color space) have you specified the colors? (rgb, dkl, lms, hsv)

borderWidth.label: Outer border width
borderWidth.hint: Width of the line around the outer part of the target

innerBorderWidth.label: Inner border width
innerBorderWidth.hint: Width of the line around the inner part of the target

outerRadius.label: Outer radius
outerRadius.hint: Size (radius) of the outer part of the target

innerRadius.label: Inner radius
innerRadius.hint: Size (radius) of the inner part of the target

progressMode.label: Progress mode
progressMode.hint: Should the target move to the next position after a keypress or after an amount of time?

targetDur.label: Target duration
targetDur.hint: Time limit (s) after which progress to next position

expandDur.label: Expand / contract duration
expandDur.hint: Duration of the target expand/contract animation

expandScale.label: Expand scale
expandScale.hint: How many times bigger than its size the target grows

movementAnimation.label: Animate position changes
movementAnimation.hint: Enable / disable animations as target stim changes position

movementDur.label: Movement duration
movementDur.hint: Duration of the animation during position changes.

targetDelay.label: Target delay
targetDelay.hint: Duration of the delay between positions.

showResults.label: Show results screen
showResults.hint: Show a screen with results after completion?

units.hint: Units of dimensions for this stimulus

PavloviaSurveyRoutine.tooltip: Run a SurveyJS survey in Pavlovia

name.label: Name
name.hint: Name of this Routine (alphanumeric or _, no spaces)

allowedLabels.label: Survey id
allowedLabels.body: Linking to a survey ID from Pavlovia Surveys means that the content will automatically update if that survey changes (better for dynamic use)
allowedLabels.linkText: How do I get my survey ID?

allowedLabels.label: Survey Model File
allowedLabels.body: Inserting a JSON file (exported from Pavlovia Surveys) means that the survey is embedded within this project and will not change unless you import it again (better for archiving)
allowedLabels.linkText: How do I get my survey model file?

surveyId.label: Survey id
surveyId.hint: The ID for your survey on Pavlovia. Tip: Right click to open the survey in your browser!

surveyJson.label: Survey JSON
surveyJson.hint: File path of the JSON file used to construct the survey
